intro: Bomarea patacocensis var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Its leaves are usually broad and lanceolate, and the flowers range in color from white to pink. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves, contributing to its ornamental value.
